creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: lush blooming peony garden within a wooden structure; at center, a young woman in blue kimono with pink coat addresses a young girl while an older woman in purple kimono looks at the child; at UL, a group of women and a few men take in the gardens
marks: left: 自摺　東京拾二題　昭和三年作　落合徳川ぼたん園 {Jizuri, Tōkyō jūni LLC: よし田 {Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on silk
title: The Tokugawa Peony Garden at Ochiai
